alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 03 at 12:59PM PST until January 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST THURSDAY... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO 10 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 12 to 16 feet with dangerous rip currents. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 8 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, from 6 AM Thursday to 10 AM PST Friday. For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Powerful waves and strong rip currents will pose an exceptional risk of ocean drowning and damage to coastal structures like piers and jetties. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Surf may diminish briefly tonight and Wednesday morning, but will begin to increase Wednesday afternoon.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other water side infrastructure.
